diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Ileocolonic intussusception associated with syncope (neurologic intussusception)
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Seizures, head trauma, infection (meningitis or encephalitis), accidental ingestion, metabolic derangement, cardiac arrhythmia, evolving sepsis, primary neurologic diseases.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's persistent altered mental status, intermittent vomiting episodes, normal neurologic examination, and negative neuroimaging suggested a non-neurologic cause, with the diagnosis of intussusception being strongly supported by radiographic findings indicative of the condition. The normal neurologic parameters and the clinical history led to a high suspicion of neurologic intussusception.
